attributes.action: Review the way interest is added to student loans.
attributes.background: Many young people will never afford to pay back their student loan.  Not only does the current system saddle young people with debt, it is not good for their mental health to know the loan is being added to monthly. The proposal here is to review the student loan interest system.
attributes.additional_details: Reducing interest rates, to be in line with the current Bank of England interest rate plus running cost of a non profit making company, seems to be a much better prospect for young people. The government will have to pick up the bill for any remaining loan, once the student is 53 years old. Let’s make a system work where young people can realistically pay their loans off or a system where the government subsidises all loans.

attributes.action: Stop childcare providers charging parents when they are closed or have holiday.
attributes.background: This is a petition to stop parents being held to ransom by childcare providers! Currently nurseries/child minders are allowed to charge parents up to a full days rate for care when they are closed for bank holidays, staff training and xmas. Resulting in working parents taking holiday or upaid leave.

attributes.action: Introduce National Conscription with the opportunity to volunteer overeseas.
attributes.background: It seems it would be more constructive to direct school leavers at 16 or 18 to have the opportunity to be part of a group who provide the opportunity to engage in social positive role model building than to be unemployed and idle when so much help is needed across society. A better use of gov money.
attributes.additional_details: Knife crime, scooter mugging, drug taking and obesity are all escalating issues amongst young people both as perpetrators and victims. National Conscription for one year with the opporuntiy to volunteer abroad could be such a constructive initiative following the lead of Norway, Denmark and Israel - three of the happiest, most disciplined, best-educated countries in the world. Germany, France and Italy are considering something similar.

attributes.action: Make it compulsory to have lifeguards on all popular beaches in the UK
attributes.background: Too many people are dying in the sea, if there was lifeguards around there wouldn't be so many deaths.

attributes.action: Ban public smoking outside of designated smoking areas.
attributes.background: After seeing and experiencing secondhand smoke in public and having not chosen to experience secondhand smoke I believe smokers should be obligated to not expose others to smoke. If violated an appropriate fine should be given to offenders.
attributes.additional_details:
https://www.cancerresearchuk.org/about-cancer/causes-of-cancer/smoking-and-cancer/passive-smoking

https://www.cdc.gov/tobacco/data_statistics/fact_sheets/secondhand_smoke/health_effects/index.htm

https://www.nhs.uk/smokefree/why-quit/secondhand-smoke

attributes.action: Revisit the NHS Pay Deal 2018 as the initial communications were misleading
attributes.background: The detail released to NHS staff and Unions from NHS Employers was misleading and staff and unions have voted based on the information initially provided. This has resulted in large numbers of staff not receiving a 6% pay increase over 3 years as communicated.

attributes.action: Set up screening programme for adult scoliosis patients for respiratory problems
attributes.background: Severe scoliosis can cause breathing problems and respiratory failure. Some scoliosis patients have been unexpectedly told they need oxygen and ventilators and may be in respiratory failure before they are treated.
attributes.additional_details: If lung function tests and sleep studies were carried out on these patients annually, the signs of respiratory failure would be picked up earlier, and they would be able to receive other forms of treatment such as pulmonary rehab and inhalers, rather than going straight on to oxygen and ventilators.

attributes.action: Change The Word Disabled to Enabled on Government publications.
attributes.background: In the past few decades those with physical, mental and illness have been called offensive, and dis-empowering names, focused on limitations and weakness. It is time to Stop Disabling us. Enable Us.
attributes.additional_details: Word's have power. Labelling and Disabling individuals you take away their power to be who they are, forcing them to prove and live in their challenges, focused on what they can not do. It also opens the system for fraud. Whatever the needs of a person to disable them prevents them from the support they need to fulfil their purpose, writing them off as DISABLED. A simple change with the word Enabled changes the way people are supported, and brings a can do attitude, and system that supports.

attributes.action: Allow the possession of a registered pepper spray as a self-defence weapon
attributes.background: In face of looming and spiralling out of control knife and noxious substances, the law abiding citizens and residents have literally no means to protect themselves from thugs, muggings, random knife attacks, gun point attacks, rape and more serious GBHs. We're asking HM government to act now!
attributes.additional_details: In face of looming and spiralling out of control knife and noxious substances, the law abiding citizens and residents have literally no means to protect themselves from thugs, muggings, random knife attacks, gun point attacks, rape and more serious GBHs. We're asking HM government to follow the example of other EU countries such as  Austria, Czech, Denmark, Finland ( en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Pepper_spray) and allow the possession of a registered pepper spray as a self defence weapon.

attributes.action: Make ice cream van drivers pass a DBS check before attaining a trading license
attributes.background: Let’s make our children and communities safe. Ice cream sellers regularly deal with children. Make it legislation they must pass a DBS check prior to trading

attributes.action: Require all Blue Badge parking to be free
attributes.background: More & more frequently we are finding that Blue Badge parking is being charged at normal tariffs.
attributes.additional_details:
Blue Badge holders are the most severely disabled of all with life limiting or terminal diagnosis. 

Holders are restricted to the work they can do and are therefore limited to what they can potentially earn. 
 
Holders generally have increased expenses and are therefore more frugal with the funds available to them that non-disabled persons do not have.

Blue Badge Holders generally have to attend appointments at hospital/s at a greater frequency which also limits ability to earn whilst adding pressures to their earnings.

attributes.action: Give Support workers right to eat their own food in cafes etc
attributes.background: I work as a Support Worker with people with learning disabilities. I love to take them to places to eat out I cannot afford to eat with them. I’d like to be able if possible to eat my pack lunch while they enjoy their meal.
attributes.additional_details: I'd like to see all places where people can eat be required to allow support workers and carers who are supporting a person to eat at their establishments to be able to eat their own food should they wish to do so.

attributes.action: Increase the VAT threshold for small businesses to £110k
attributes.background: Cost of materials and other services e.g energy new technology and regulations have gone up but small businesses struggle to pass this cost on immediately. Small businesses do contribute towards VAT through above costs but never reclaim. We require this small assistant to keep the business afloat.
attributes.additional_details: Small businesses are the foundation of this country. With the current political uncertainty and rising costs, small businesses are feeling the brunt of it and finding difficult to "make ends meet" and rapidly verging on to impossible. This small gesture from the government will help small businesses to thrive on and become stable to help build the countries future.

attributes.action: Military personnel should not pay any UK taxes when abroad or on bonuses
attributes.background: Military personnel pay taxes on bonuses they receive for staying in service and any extra money they receive when leaving their loved ones behind to go and serve abroad, yet they get taxed when not even in the country so I want to abolish this and have them only pay when in the country.
attributes.additional_details: People in the military should not have to pay UK taxes or national insurance when abroad or be taxed on any bonus payments they receive such as the commitment bonus for staying in military service or receiving extra money when being sent away from home as they aren’t even in the country at that time So why should they pay towards it especially since they deploy for months at a time where they don’t get to see family or friends and it isn’t pleasant when they do go away.

attributes.action: Ban Helium in party balloons.
attributes.background: Helium is used to inflate party balloons. We believe that helium, as a finite resource, should be used exclusively for essential needs such as medial purposes. Party balloons can be used with air to create great displays. Parts of Norway have banned helium for balloons and the UK should follow.
attributes.additional_details:
Norway helium ban
https://www.plasticsoupfoundation.org/en/2018/05/norway-bans-helium-balloons/

Alternative ways to display balloons without using helium
https://www.getpersonalised.net/personalised-balloons/displaying-number-balloons-with-air-lets-stop-the-helium/

attributes.action: Ask government to force car manufactures to must include spare wheel in all cars
attributes.background: Not having a spare wheel causes , unnecessary waste of time,obstructions, gives stress and force motorists to join a recovery service.

attributes.action: Make CCTV mandatory in car parks
attributes.background:
Have you ever returned to your parked car and found it damaged by another vehicle? 

If the driver of the other vehicle doesn’t leave a note, they are committing a hit and run offence.

But without CCVT, the chances of catching them are slim and YOU are forced to foot the bill!
attributes.additional_details:
I use NCP assuming it’s the safest place to park. Turns out they don’t have CCTV! My car has been damaged by another vehicle and the driver didn’t leave a note, so I have to foot the bill. It’s nearly Christmas and I have a baby. Somebody else’s cowardly actions mean I have to pay a high excess to claim on insurance and lose my no claims bonus, or pay out more for private repairs.

If you’re sick of paying for others’ crimes, please sign my petition to make all car parks install CCTV. Thank you.

attributes.action: Ban the Sale of Puppies and Kittens in Pet Shops in the UK.
attributes.background: It can be hard to resist cute puppies and kittens for sale in pet-store windows. But a closer look into how these stores obtain animals reveals a system in which the high price that consumers pay for “that doggie in the window”.
attributes.additional_details:
It is a victory for the Lucy's Law campaign, which has been calling for the ban to be implemented.

The campaign was named after a Cavalier King Charles Spaniel who was badly treated in the puppy farming system.

attributes.action: Create hospital wards for young adults (16-21)
attributes.background: My daughter has a congenital heart defect and has been admitted to hospital many times in since turning 16 as she is no longer classed as a child patient this means she is put on adult wards which are often mixed this is uncomfortable for any young person.
attributes.additional_details: I believe that all hospitals should have wards for young people to help with the transition between child and adult services, I feel that a young person being placed on an adult ward is daunting, stressful, worrying and uncomfortable. Mixing 16-21 year olds girls with men in their 70’s, 80’s & 90’s or vice versa is not ideal! This needs to change

attributes.action: Give public vote on brexit either to accept the deal or leave with a no deal
attributes.background: We have voted to leave in a fair and democratic vote, we now need to vote on whether we agree with the governments deal to leave the EU or do we want to leave with a no deal

attributes.action: Allow Chris Brown entry into the U.K.
attributes.background: In 2010, Chris Brown was refused permission to enter the U.K. on the grounds of being guilty of a serious criminal offence. Since then, Chris Brown has paid the price for his earlier mistakes and has shown time and time again that he is a changed man through his actions and his music.
attributes.additional_details: Home office stated in 2010, “public safety is one of our primary concerns”, however, Mr. Brown poses no threat to the general public. Instead he is a source of joy to his fans, especially those in the U.K. who can only experience this vicariously through his social media presence. Therefore we ask that you please sign this petition, so our government can consider a reversal of the refusal of his entry to the U.K.

attributes.action: Stop UK Government foreign aid to India
attributes.background: UK’s global aid commitment is in the countries national interest, but when £330 million is squandered on a giant bronze statue in India it must be seriously evaluated whether that money could not better be spent at home.

attributes.action: Make it statutory that dogs dna can collected so that councils can fine owners
attributes.background: Dog mess is causing a huge issue in our community by those owners who don’t clear up after their dogs faeces.  It’s already illegal to not clear up after them however you have to be caught in the act.  Let’s empower our environmental officers to deal with this ever growing issue.

attributes.action: workers on benefits should be able to do overtime when needed without deductions
attributes.background: Workers who claim benefits should be able to do overtime e.g. 20 hours, when needed, over a tax year to help in times of hardship. After the capped overtime hours have been used you cannot do anymore in that year.
attributes.additional_details: This proposal came about after I wanted to consider overtime to help me and my son, but I am unable to do so.

attributes.action: Should be a pets NHS. Not every1 can afford their pets ops and treatments
attributes.background: If you can't afford your pets operations or treatments they end up getting put down and its not fair. If your from a working class family it can be hard providing for your family as well as paying huge vet bills. Pets are part of the family!:)xxx
attributes.additional_details: please sign

attributes.action: Extend the maximum length of a caravan towed by a 3.5 tonne vehicle from 7m
attributes.background: The current law stops you towing a caravan more than 7m long with anything less than 3.5 tonne vehicle when a lot of vehicles less than 3.5 tonne are capable of towing these caravans
attributes.additional_details: There seems to be more and more caravans now especially foreign caravans that are more than 7m long these can currently only be towed with a vehicle more than 3.5 tonne a lot of people still tow illegally with less than 3.5 tonne as most campsites don’t allow Comercial vehicles so this makes it hard to stay legal and still be able to enjoy using bigger family friendly caravans

attributes.action: Require care providers and all staff to be qualified and registered
attributes.background: Care is in crisis. There are regular reports of older and vulnerable people being abused and neglected. Most carers are hard-working professionals, but to increase confidence and standards everyone in the care industry should be regulated.
attributes.additional_details: Staff at every level should be registered, increasing protection for the vulnerable but also placing carers on a professional footing. The cost of registration should be borne by providers. This register is not a criticism of hard-working care staff, and should increase their status and security, while registration of senior staff will enable them to be held accountable if they fail to provide good care.

attributes.action: Food labelling re sugar to simple & straight forward for all
attributes.background:
I believe all foodstuffs should just have a picture of a spoon of  sugar with a number on it denoting the amount in total in that product.
There are too many guises for sugar that consumers do not understand.

attributes.action: Make 'Environmental Awareness' a compulsory subject in the National Curriculum.
attributes.background: I want to act in the name of our environment. Look how much has changed in a decade! Images of the declining beauty of our natural environment frustrate me. We need to stop this. Please support me! I am calling on all supporters of this cause!
attributes.additional_details:
This is not an issue that can be contained and alluded to only in geography lessons anymore. 
We need a subject entirely dedicated to educating students about protecting the environment and making them aware from a young age that they need to save it! We cannot stand by and witness the decline of our world anymore. My voice will not be heard without your support!

attributes.action: Make cases of unfair dismissal appealable for any employee post-probation
attributes.background: Anyone who has served less than 2 years at a company has greatly reduced rights. Employers can easily make unfair dismissals in this period, unless it counts as automatically unfair. In any other case, including those which would lead to a concrete case against an employer, this is not appealable.

attributes.action: Make companies who have joint bills chase both parties for the debt
attributes.background: A lot of newly single mothers or fathers, who may have been subject to controlling behaviour, are left with bills that were half theirs but whilst paying them are not receiving help from the other payer. It should be made law that companies bill both payers so that the system is fairer.
attributes.additional_details: Severn Trent, Council Tax etc are all bills that will chase the home occupier for a full balance. However if an account has been in two peoples names previously it isn’t possible to split the bill and chase the other person. This is leaving many single parents with huge debt that they struggle to pay. Universal credit will split an advance repayment if there is a break of parties as should all other companies to make the system fairer. Particularly for victims of gambling, control and abuse.

attributes.action: Enable ILR for Tier 2 Established Staff Visa holders
attributes.background: As per the current rules, Tier 2 ICT Visa holders, which was issued before April 2010, are eligible for ILR. In April 2010, rules were changed, and Tier 2 ICT Visa was given with the name as Established-Staff until April 2011. This Visa can be extended any number of times but not eligible for ILR.
attributes.additional_details: This petition is for enabling ILR after completion of 5 years for Established-staff category Visa holders. Visa holders stay in the country for more than 6 years, but not eligible for ILR under 5-year route. The number of Visas issued between April 2010 and 2011 is much less and few people are remaining in the country right now. So, please enable ILR for Established staff category Visa holders under 5-year rule.

attributes.action: Patient transport and emergency vehicles, at all times, be allowed in bus lanes
attributes.background: Buses , taxis for profit and cycles are allowed in bus lanes. Patient transport ambulances sit in traffic so are late for essential appointments such as dialysis. Front line emergency crews waste time that could be spent responding while buses, taxis and cycles use bus lanes for convenience.
attributes.additional_details: Drive through Oxford, Reading or London for any evidence you wish to gather.

attributes.action: Homeoffice should not over charge health surcharge from UK Visa Applicants
attributes.background: UK Suppose Visa is issued for 33 Months however applicants are being charged for three Full years.
attributes.additional_details:
As per GOV.UK health surcharge for Visa Applicants is £200 per year at the moment as it going to be increased.
Why there is full 1 health surcharge where Visa is being issued for less than a year.
For example suppose Visa is issued for 33 months but Applicants have to pay health surcharge full £600 which is for 3 full years.

attributes.action: Stop the use of plastic milk bottles and return to glass bottles
attributes.background: Plastic milk bottles generate more toxic waste through recycling than the-using 100% recyclable glass milk bottles. Plastic milk bottles are just as bad as non-recyclable plastics and should be outlawed
attributes.additional_details: Refer to BBC program Blue Planet

attributes.action: Compulsory training for all services and organisations on all Assistance Dogs
attributes.background: We would like it to be compulsory for any organisation offering a product, service (whether public or private) or recreational events or activities whether or not publicly accessible to the public to have thorough, frequent, unbiased and accurate awareness training on ALL types of assistance dogs.
attributes.additional_details:
I am a handler of an owner trained assistance dog. Luckily I have only been refused access to a service once, but I know many people have had several access issues despite it being 2019.

I am happy to help with the rollout of this training and personally help to train people and organisations myself.

attributes.action: Reject the Brexit Deal agreed by Theresa May and reopen negotiations immediately
attributes.background: Theresa May and her followers have negotiated a very poor and unfair deal for the UK. Her misguided deal would mean Northern Ireland would have different trade rules than the UK (thus endangering the Union). We would also not be allowed to leave the Backstop (Protocol) without the EU's agreement.
attributes.additional_details:
This deal needs to be rejected by the British people. It does not allow us freedom from the EU and binds our hands. It even agrees to extending the transition period if agreement can't be reached! 
 
It doesn't matter what party you vote for, or whether you are a Brexiteer or a Remainer, EVERYONE who cares for this country has to vote against this awful deal + sign this petition. Read the deal yourself and you'll be shocked at how much sovereignty we'd be giving away. SAVE THE UK!

attributes.action: Ban Smoking / Vapouring outside train station or Near Bus stop
attributes.background: During winter tobacco smoking / Vapouring outside Train station and Bus stop is more to keep them warm. We are becoming Passive smokers including Kids.During peak hours it is smoky.

attributes.action: Stop insurance discrimination affecting those with pre existing medical issues
attributes.background: Our society (rightly) talks about equality and yet the Government accepts insurance companies charging people more money for taking out policies - if they have a pre existing medical condition. It's blatant prejudice and discrimination. The government must stop this insurance industry-led practice.
attributes.additional_details: The Government has said (in a letter to MP David Davies) that this is a commercial matter. Yet human rights are not a commercial matter. Life & CIC insurance is necessary for security. The Universal Declaration of Human Rights says: Article 25. (1) Everyone has the right to security in the event of unemployment, sickness, disability... in circumstances beyond his control. 'Everyone' includes people with pre existing medical conditions who cannot afford higher premiums for life/CIC insurance.

attributes.action: Abolish faith schools
attributes.background: Children under no circumstance should be submitted to education in religious schools. We should encourage future generations to have an academic mindset free from religious belief.
attributes.additional_details: Religion is a choice that should be made in adulthood and not influenced and preached onto young growing minds.

attributes.action: Protect victims of domestic violence who come from the European Union
attributes.background: To date, UK immigration legislation offers protection for victims of domestic violence who hold a non-European passport. There are no easements for victims who hold a European passport, if the perpetrator was British. I believe this is in breach of art 14 ECHR, freedom from discrimination.
attributes.additional_details:
Non-EEA citizens who are victims of domestic violence can apply for indefinite leave to remain by virtue of having been a victim of domestic violence, regardless of employment status in the UK.
 
These rights do not apply to EEA nationals.  They can only qualify for settled status if they are workers, or family members of a foreign worker. This does not protect victims adequately, especially if they have been prevented from working due to coercive and controlling behaviour.

attributes.action: Make it law for alcohol producers to put all ingredients used on packaging
attributes.background: A lot of alcohol contains hidden ingredients people wouldn't think of: such as lactose and isinglass. These ingredients/processing methods may go against peoples' religious beliefs or they may be allergic to these ingredients.
attributes.additional_details: Often when emailing companies to enquire about the brewing/fermenting process or even just ingredients they will not give you a straight answer, or will tell you something whilst telling other people conflicting information. To avoid this I believe it would be simpler for companies to put ingredients and manufacturing methods on packaging or have the information freely available on websites. This would avoid any health complications due to hidden ingredients/manufacturing processes.

attributes.action: Ban tenancies that require rent paid in advance for social housing
attributes.background: Becuase im on universal credit I have to pay £20 pound on top of my rent. Because my rent is meant to be paid in advance but the housing element is paid in arreas, and if I dont pay this I will be breaching my tenacy agreement, I want social housing to be banned from making tenancies like this.
attributes.additional_details: Or if they cant stop making tenancies like this make universal credit housing element paid weekly.

attributes.action: Hold a country wide referendum on whether we should bring back the death penalty
attributes.background: Our prisons are overcrowded and under funded bringing back the death penalty for crimes such as murder,terrorism,rape and peodphillia will reduce our prison population and will also save the tax payer millions if not billions a year.

attributes.action: Give an mandatory prison sentence after a death due to physical assault
attributes.background: My father was killed by a punch to the head in 2004 and has never received justice, the man who killed him received only community service as he done a plea bargain and admitted culpable homicide. If you hit someone and kill them it should be a mandatory prison sentence.
attributes.additional_details: No one should be able to enter a plea bargain if they hit someone and the person dies as a result. We all know right from wrong and if you kill someone then justice should serve an instant prison sentence whatever your intentions. We lost my father in 2004 and all the accused got was community service. Where's the justice in that? What does that mean for my poor father who dies of a single punch to the head? He ended up brain dead because of his injury. Help me to stop this.

attributes.action: Fund clinical trials in Alzheimer's based on the aldehyde toxicity hypothesis
attributes.background: There is increasing evidence to suggest Alzheimer's is caused by aldehyde toxicity. It stands to reason that medical protocol based on this hypothesis could be invaluable in the prevention and treatment of this devastating neurodegenerative condition afflicting the ageing population.
attributes.additional_details:
Public funding should be used to investigate a therapeutic cocktail of the following compounds in clinical trials to reduce the economic burden of Alzheimer's and dementia and improve quality of life in the ageing population:

N-acetylcysteine (NAC)
Niacin (nicotinic acid form)
Zinc
Molybdenum
Alpha lipoic acid
Selenium
Sulforaphane

Collectively, these compounds are integral in aldehyde detoxification and would present a powerful weapon against neurodegenerative disorders such as Alzheimer's.

attributes.action: Allow Industrial Hemp to be grown without a Home Office License (4 plants)
attributes.background: I propose a registered scheme with local police to allow UK adults to grow 4 plants of Industrial Hemp ONLY at home without a Home Office License. With tested seeds that are below 0.2% THC. Allowing individuals to grow safe CBD Hemp at home for personal use only . With labelled & tagged plants.
attributes.additional_details:
Iskedjian et al. Meta-analysis of cannabis based treatments for neuropathic and multiple sclerosis-related pain. Curr Med Res Opin. 23(1):17-24.(2007).
 Bergamaschi et al. Safety and side effects of cannabidiol, a Cannabis sativa constituent. Curr Drug Saf. 2011 Sep 1;6(4):237-49.

The fact there has never been a single recorded case of a death caused by CBD or even a psychotic episode caused by CBD . I am in no way endorsing Recreational Cannabis , but urging you to consider this alternative.

attributes.action: Make it law for all restaurants to provide Braille menus.
attributes.background: Why should people not have the option to read a menu? Perhaps it's something that we sighted people take for granted. In order for visually impaired people to gain more independence, it's important that they're actually able to read a menu for themselves.

attributes.action: Increase limit for when charities must have an independent review of accounts
attributes.background: I am involved with a charity which makes approximately £25-£30k per year, meaning we must have an independent review.  This cost us £2500 this year, which seems a disproportionately high percentage of our income.   Increasing the limit to £50k could help charities give more to the causes we support.
attributes.additional_details: According to gov.uk, there were approximately 58 thousand charities in the UK with income between £10k and £100k.  If we assume that these are evenly distributed across the range, around 16000 charities would benefit.  If their costs are similar to ours, that would be an extra £45k going to good cause each year.  While transparency is important, people give to small charities assuming the money goes to the cause they promote and 10% going to an auditor does not serve their expectations well.

attributes.action: Increase funding for suicide research & offer specialist support to stop it.
attributes.background: As a mother raising children in the UK, I have a burning desire to find out why suicide is on the increase, especially amongst the male age group 18 - 49, support needs to be given to stop it & assistance mechanisms should be put in place to stop these unnecessary deaths.
attributes.additional_details: Suicide can happen to any family at anytime & it leaves them devastated. We need to reach out to those who are susceptible and ensure that they are able to get any assistance they need before they make the difficult choice to take their own life. It is a silent killer and more most be done so that individuals considering it are able to open up and discuss their problems rather than feel that suicide is the only option.
